intro: Crotalaria tiantaiensis, commonly known as the Tiantai cowpea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
